properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 3:29AM MST until January 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT MOUNTAIN SNOW THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...

.Snow will begin across east-central Oregon and the mountains of
west-central Idaho tonight as the first in a series of low
pressure systems impacts the region. The mountains will see
periods of heavy snow through Tuesday as three separate storm
systems track through the Pacific Northwest. Valley locations will
see periods of snow through Tuesday with accumulating snow
becoming more likely heading into early next week.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations through Tuesday
afternoon of 5 to 10 inches, with 1 to 2 feet in more snow prone
valleys to include Sumpter and Halfway. Up to 3 feet across the
higher peaks. Winds gusting to 30 MPH tonight and Saturday will
cause blowing and drifting.

* WHERE...Baker County zone.

* WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 4 PM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY
